intro: Spermodon setaceus, commonly known as the silky lichen, is a foliose lichen that belongs to the family Parmeliaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, leaf-like thallus that is usually pale green to yellowish in color. The plant forms a symbiotic relationship with algae, which provide photosynthetic nutrients, while the fungal component offers structural support and protection. It typically grows on bark, stone, or wood in moist, shaded environments. Spermodon setaceus is often found in temperate regions and is used as an indicator of air quality due to its sensitivity to pollution.
